alert.note: Alert for Ashley (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Ashley County through 445 PM CDT... At 417 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crossett, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Crossett around 420 PM CDT. North Crossett and Berlin around 445 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
